data.name: LearnHeader
data.value: Learn more on Scripture Forge

data.name: LearnHow
data.value: Learn how to setup and use community checking, see how to collaborate on editing Scripture, and learn how to setup and use translation suggestions when editing Scripture.

data.name: LearnSliderCheckingSeeAnswer
data.value: {0}Answer questions{1} with text or audio, or both

data.name: LearnSliderCheckingSeeConnect
data.value: {0}Connect to a project{1} in Scripture Forge that you have been invited to join

data.name: LearnSliderCheckingSeeDescription
data.value: {0}Watch this video{1} to see how community {2}Checkers{3} answers questions and interact with each other. This video shows how to:

data.name: LearnSliderCheckingSeeHeader
data.value: See How Community Checking Works

data.name: LearnSliderCheckingSeeInteract
data.value: {0}Interact{1} with other {2}Checkers{3} by adding comments to their answers

data.name: LearnSliderCheckingSeeReference
data.value: {0}Select Scripture{1} to reference with your answer

data.name: LearnSliderCheckingSetupAddQuestions
data.value: {0}Add questions{1} to be checked by the community. Questions can include text, audio, or both. The audio could be the question, or the Scripture being read, or both

data.name: LearnSliderCheckingSetupConnect
data.value: {0}Connect to a Paratext project{1} in Scripture Forge

data.name: LearnSliderCheckingSetupDescription
data.value: As the {0}Administrator{1} of a Paratext project, {2}watch this video{3} for how to setup Community Checking. This video shows how to:

data.name: LearnSliderCheckingSetupHeader
data.value: Setup Community Checking

data.name: LearnSliderCheckingSetupShare
data.value: {0}Share the project{1} by inviting {2}Checkers{3} to answer questions

data.name: LearnSliderCheckingSetupSync
data.value: After community {0}Checkers{1} have answered some questions, {2}synchronize the answers{3} back to Paratext

data.name: LearnSliderSuggestionSetupBest
data.value: This works best on {0}closely related projects{1} with a similar grammar and using a similar style of translation. Adaptation projects are good candidates for effectively using translation suggestions. Ensure the verses and segments are aligned between the two projects. You can do this easily in Paratext if your project is a Daughter Translation of the Based-on project.

data.name: LearnSliderSuggestionSetupDescription
data.value: On a project, in Settings, enable {0}Translation Suggestions{1} and choose the project this translation is {0}Based-on{1}. It may take quite some time to train the suggestion engine if there is already a lot of Scripture translated.

data.name: LearnSliderSuggestionSetupHeader
data.value: Setup Translation Suggestions

data.name: LearnSliderSuggestionAcceptDescription
data.value: Once the suggestion engine is setup and trained, as you type, Scripture Forge may {0}offer suggestions{1} on how to translate the next word or phrase.

data.name: LearnSliderSuggestionAcceptEnter
data.value: Hit {0}ENTER{1} or click on the suggestion to accept it.

data.name: LearnSliderSuggestionAcceptEsc
data.value: Hit {0}ESC{1} or continue typing to ignore the suggestion.

data.name: LearnSliderSuggestionAcceptHeader
data.value: Accept a Translation Suggestion

data.name: LearnSliderSuggestionAcceptLearn
data.value: The {0}suggestion engine will learn{1} when you finish editing a verse and move to the next verse. Use tab or arrow keys to move to the next verse or segment.

data.name: LearnSliderTranslateEditDescription
data.value: Once you have connected to your Paratext project in Scripture Forge, you can {0}edit Scripture{1} the same as you can in Paratext. However, Scripture Forge works with correctly formatted text so you can't easily create poorly formatted Scripture. This is similar to using the {2}Basic{3} view in Paratext.

data.name: LearnSliderTranslateEditHeader
data.value: Edit Scripture

data.name: LearnSliderTranslateEditStructure
data.value: Text structure can't be added in Scripture Forge yet so add chapters, verses and paragraphs in Paratext, particularly when creating a book.

data.name: LearnSliderTranslateEditSync
data.value: {0}Synchronise{1} the project to keep it up-to-date with Paratext.

data.name: LearnSliderTranslateCollaborateDescription
data.value: If more than one {0}Translator{1} is connected online at the same time, they can {2}collaboratively edit{3} Scripture together.

data.name: LearnSliderTranslateCollaborateHeader
data.value: Collaborate on Scripture

data.name: LearnSliderTranslateCollaborateRealtime
data.value: Whether you are in the same room or on the other side of the world, you can easily work on the same book, the same chapter, or even the same verse. When someone is editing the same text, you can {0}see their changes in real-time{1} as they type.

data.name: LearnTitle
data.value: An Easy to Use Web Application

data.name: QuoteQuotation
data.value: It was so easy! ...all I had to do to get started was log in using my Paratext registration and boom! It was all there. Right away I chose a verse and wrote a checking question for it. Then I also recorded myself asking that checking question. Itâ€™s so great that feedback can be gathered either way. All the features are wonderful for remote contributors, including the option to answer the questions with an audio recording.

data.name: QuoteQuoterName
data.value: Trevor Deck

data.name: QuoteQuoterRole
data.value: SIL Global Diaspora Specialist

data.name: Statement
data.value: Where translation and the community meet.
